alert.note: Alert for Dougherty; Mitchell (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:22PM EDT until June 14 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN DOUGHERTY...NORTHEASTERN MITCHELL AND NORTHEASTERN BAKER COUNTIES... At 322 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Baconton, or near Putney, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Marine Corps Logistics Base around 340 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Acree, Lester, Williamsburg, Pecan City and Radium Springs. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
